last_episode_to_air.name: The Wilderness
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Starr Report brings the world to a standstill. The President is impeached. Linda faces the aftermath of her decisions, Paula makes desperate choices, and Monica considers how to move on with her life.

name: American Crime Story
overview: An anthology series centered around some of history's most famous criminal investigations.

seasons.name: The People v. O.J. Simpson
seasons.overview: Season one takes you inside the O.J. Simpson trial with a riveting look at the legal teams battling to convict or acquit the football legend of double homicide. Based on the book The Run of His Life: The People v. O.J. Simpson by Jeffrey Toobin, it explores the chaotic behind-the-scenes dealings and maneuvering on both sides of the court, and how a combination of prosecution overconfidence, defense shrewdness, and the LAPD's history with the city's African-American community gave a jury what it needed: reasonable doubt.

seasons.name: The Assassination of Gianni Versace
seasons.overview: Season two examines the 1997 murder of legendary fashion designer Gianni Versace outside of his Miami Beach mansion by serial killer Andrew Cunanan, interweaving storylines involving the lead-up to the murder and the criminal investigation that includes a nationwide manhunt for Cunanan.

seasons.name: Impeachment
seasons.overview: Season three tackles the Bill Clinton impeachment scandal and unravels the national crisis that swept up Paula Jones, Monica Lewinsky and Linda Tripp as principal characters in the country’s first impeachment proceedings in over a century.

tagline: You don’t know the whole story.

episodes.name: From the Ashes of Tragedy
episodes.overview: Investigators visit the home of O.J. Simpson following the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman.

episodes.name: The Run of His Life
episodes.overview: O.J. Simpson goes missing in the white Bronco and Robert Shapiro and Robert Kardashian battle the fallout while the D.A.'s office and the LAPD go searching for O.J.

episodes.name: The Dream Team
episodes.overview: Marcia reveals O.J. has been charged; Robert Shapiro seeks advice from F. Lee Bailey, creates a provocative strategy, and tries to convince O.J. to hire Johnnie Cochran.

episodes.name: 100% Not Guilty
episodes.overview: As jury selection gets underway, the entrance of Johnnie Cochran adds an interesting energy to the case.

episodes.name: The Race Card
episodes.overview: Christopher Darden and Johnnie Cochran face off in court. Chris has doubts about Mark Fuhrman as a witness. The jury visits the crime scene.

episodes.name: Marcia, Marcia, Marcia
episodes.overview: As Marcia Clark juggles her home and work obligations, she starts to feel the public scrutiny of her appearance.

episodes.name: Conspiracy Theories
episodes.overview: Some conspiracy theories concerning the case start to circulate. The prosecution talk about whether they should have O.J. Simpson try on the glove on in court.

episodes.name: A Jury in Jail
episodes.overview: Months into the trial, cut off from their families, society and the media, the jurors grow stir crazy and start becoming unlikely targets for the prosecution and the defense. Meanwhile, the country is introduced to the science of DNA evidence.

episodes.name: Manna from Heaven
episodes.overview: Johnnie Cochran and F. Lee Bailey head across the country to get their hands on the Mark Fuhrman tapes. Judge Ito must decide whether the tapes, and the racial epithets they contain, are admissible.

episodes.name: The Verdict
episodes.overview: In the season finale, the prosecution and defense make their closing statements; the jurors deliberate; and the verdict is given.

1.name: The People v. O.J. Simpson
1.overview: Season one takes you inside the O.J. Simpson trial with a riveting look at the legal teams battling to convict or acquit the football legend of double homicide. Based on the book The Run of His Life: The People v. O.J. Simpson by Jeffrey Toobin, it explores the chaotic behind-the-scenes dealings and maneuvering on both sides of the court, and how a combination of prosecution overconfidence, defense shrewdness, and the LAPD's history with the city's African-American community gave a jury what it needed: reasonable doubt.

episodes.name: The Man Who Would Be Vogue
episodes.overview: The murder of Gianni Versace turns the eyes of the world onto Miami Beach.

episodes.name: Manhunt
episodes.overview: Andrew Cunanan arrives in Miami to stalk fashion designer Gianni Versace.

episodes.name: A Random Killing
episodes.overview: Chicago real estate tycoon Lee Miglin is murdered in what police believe is a random killing.

episodes.name: House by the Lake
episodes.overview: Minneapolis architect David Madson is forced to go on the run with Andrew Cunanan.

episodes.name: Don't Ask Don't Tell
episodes.overview: Naval officer Jeffrey Trail meets Andrew Cunanan for the first time, and Gianni Versace reveals his sexuality to the world.

episodes.name: Descent
episodes.overview: Andrew Cunanan celebrates his birthday in San Diego as his life starts to fall apart.

episodes.name: Ascent
episodes.overview: Andrew Cunanan leaves behind a troubled family life as Donatella Versace struggles to find her role within the Versace empire.

episodes.name: Creator/Destroyer
episodes.overview: A young Andrew Cunanan struggles with his oppressive father as a young Gianni Versace becomes a designer.

episodes.name: Alone
episodes.overview: The hunt for spree-killer Andrew Cunanan comes to a frantic end.

2.name: The Assassination of Gianni Versace
2.overview: Season two examines the 1997 murder of legendary fashion designer Gianni Versace outside of his Miami Beach mansion by serial killer Andrew Cunanan, interweaving storylines involving the lead-up to the murder and the criminal investigation that includes a nationwide manhunt for Cunanan.

episodes.name: Exiles
episodes.overview: After the death of her boss, White House staffer Linda Tripp is moved to The Pentagon where she meets Monica Lewinsky. Paula Jones decides to sue The President for sexual harassment.

episodes.name: The President Kissed Me
episodes.overview: Monica reveals to Linda that she is having an affair with the most powerful man in the United States.

episodes.name: Not to be Believed
episodes.overview: Tensions rise between Monica and the President. Paula is offered a settlement. Linda begins to feel that she has a target on her back.

episodes.name: The Telephone Hour
episodes.overview: Monica leans on Linda for support. Linda begins documenting their conversations.

episodes.name: Do You Hear What I Hear?
episodes.overview: As Monica prepares to leave D.C., she grows concerned that someone is sharing news about her affair. Linda meets with the FBI.

episodes.name: Man Handled
episodes.overview: The Office of the Independent Counsel ensnares Monica Lewinsky, holding her for 12 traumatizing hours in a hotel room.

episodes.name: The Assassination of Monica Lewinsky
episodes.overview: The world learns about the affair and Monica Lewinsky becomes the most famous woman in America.

episodes.name: Stand by Your Man
episodes.overview: The President must admit the truth to the Nation - and to The First Lady.

guest_stars.character: Juror Who Looks Like Kirstie Alley
guest_stars.name: Suzanne H. Smart

episodes.name: The Grand Jury
episodes.overview: Monica Lewinsky and Linda Tripp tell their stories to 23 strangers.

guest_stars.character: Juror Who Looks Like Kirstie Alley
guest_stars.name: Suzanne H. Smart

episodes.name: The Wilderness
episodes.overview: The Starr Report brings the world to a standstill. The President is impeached. Linda faces the aftermath of her decisions, Paula makes desperate choices, and Monica considers how to move on with her life.

3.name: Impeachment
3.overview: Season three tackles the Bill Clinton impeachment scandal and unravels the national crisis that swept up Paula Jones, Monica Lewinsky and Linda Tripp as principal characters in the country’s first impeachment proceedings in over a century.
